Camera placements around the robotic arm
Each camera is named sequentially from camera000 onwards for dev000 onwards.
The format is: camera_name x y z roll pitch yaw
x, y, z are in meters; roll, pitch, yaw are in radians.
Cameras are positioned on a hemisphere of radius 1.2 meters around the origin.
Cameras should always face the robotic arm located at the origin (0,0,0).
The folder example_views showcases the sim visualization of the robotic arm with the camera poses shown here.

0 Degree ring cameras:
Position of camera000 is: x: 1.2 y: 0.0 z: 0.0 roll: 0 pitch: 0.0 yaw: -3.141592653589793
Position of camera001 is: x: 1.0392304845413265 y: 0.5999999999999999 z: 0.0 roll: 0 pitch: 0.0 yaw: -2.6179938779914944

Top cameras:
Position of camera108 is: x: 0 y: 0 z: 1.2 roll: 0 pitch: 1.5707963267948966 yaw: 0
Position of camera109 is: x: 0 y: 0 z: 1.2 roll: 0 pitch: 1.5707963267948966 yaw: -1.5707963267948966
Position of camera110 is: x: 0 y: 0 z: 1.2 roll: 0 pitch: 1.5707963267948966 yaw: -3.141592653589793
Position of camera111 is: x: 0 y: 0 z: 1.2 roll: 0 pitch: 1.5707963267948966 yaw: 1.5707963267948966

The measurement unit used in this file is in meters and radians.
Cameras should always face the robotic arm.
The folder example_views showcases the sim visualization of the robotic arm with the camera poses shown here.
